required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Of The Effect Of Fragmin In The Treatment Of Neuroischaemic Foot Ulcers In Diabetic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A 6 Month, Prospective, Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Group, Multiple Center Trial To Evaluate The Efficacy And Safety Of Fragmin In The Treatment Of Chronic Neuroischaemic Foot Ulcers In Diabetic Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study isto see the effect of Fragmin on the healing of diabetic foot ulcers by determining the number of subjects with â‰¥50% reduction in ulcer surface area including intact skin healing.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Greater Than or Equal to 50 Percent Reduction in Ulcer Surface Area Including Intact Skin Healing
primary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24 [end of treatment (EOT)] or early termination
primary_outcome.description: University of Texas (UT) system assesses ulcer depth, wound infection and clinical signs of lower-extremity ischemia. UT Wound Classification (1C/2C) was based on grade (0= healed site to 3= penetrating wound to bone or joint) and stage (A= clean wounds to D= ischaemic infected wounds) of wounds. Participants were evaluated at 4 stratums: Stratum 1: Toe pressure>30 mm of mercury (mmHg) and UT grade and stage 1C. Stratum 2: Toe pressure<=30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 1C. Stratum 3: Toe pressure>30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 2C. Stratum 4: Toe pressure<=30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 2C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Intact Skin Healing
secondary_outcome.description: Intact skin healing was defined as 100 percent reduction in ulcer surface area with full epithelialisation. UT system assesses ulcer depth, wound infection and clinical signs of lower-extremity ischemia. Participants were evaluated at 4 stratums: Stratum 1: Toe pressure>30 mm of mercury (mmHg) and UT grade and stage 1C. Stratum 2: Toe pressure<=30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 1C. Stratum 3: Toe pressure>30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 2C. Stratum 4: Toe pressure<=30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 2C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Underwent Any Amputation
secondary_outcome.description: Any amputation included both major and minor amputations. A major amputation was defined as above the ankle and was reported as below-the-knee and above-the-knee amputations. A minor amputation was defined as below the ankle amputation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Underwent Major and Minor Amputation
secondary_outcome.description: A major amputation was defined as above the ankle and was reported as below-the-knee and above-the-knee amputations. A minor amputation was defined as below the ankle amputation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Greater Than or Equal to 50 Percent Reduction in Ulcer Surface Area Excluding Intact Skin Healing
secondary_outcome.description: University of Texas (UT) system assesses ulcer depth, wound infection and clinical signs of lower-extremity ischemia. UT Wound Classification (1C/2C) was based on grade (0= healed site to 3= penetrating wound to bone or joint) and stage (A= clean wounds to D= ischaemic infected wounds) of wounds. Participants were evaluated at 4 stratums: Stratum 1: Toe pressure>30 mm of mercury (mmHg) and UT grade and stage 1C. Stratum 2: Toe pressure<=30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 1C. Stratum 3: Toe pressure>30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 2C. Stratum 4: Toe pressure<=30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 2C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Major Cardiovascular Disease Events (MCVE)
secondary_outcome.description: Major cardiovascular events were defined as death due to vascular cause; non-fatal myocardial infarction (MI) excluding procedure related to MI; coronary revascularization procedures not related to MIs; hospitalization for unstable angina or non-fatal stroke.
Median time taken to achieve intact skin healing which was defined as 100 percent reduction in ulcer surface area with full epithelialisation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Euro Quality of Life-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D)- Utility Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (EOT or early termination)
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D: participant rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single utility score. It assesses level of current health for 5 domains: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain and discomfort, and anxiety and depression; 1 indicates better health state (no problems); 3 indicates worst health state (eg, "confined to bed"). Scoring formula developed by EuroQol Group assigns a utility value for each domain in profile. Score is transformed and results in a total score range -0.594 to 1.000; higher score indicates a better health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Euro Quality of Life (EQ-5D)- Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (EOT or early termination)
secondary_outcome.description: EQ-5D: participant rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single index value. The VAS component rates current health state on a scale from 0 mm (worst imaginable health state) to 100 mm (best imaginable health state); higher scores indicate a better health state.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (EOT or early termination)
secondary_outcome.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, mental health. The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (EOT or early termination)
secondary_outcome.description: The 11 point Likert pain scale which used a 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain) point rating system was used to assess participant's pain score. No distinction was made between neuropathy and inflammatory (nociceptive) pain.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (EOT or early termination)
secondary_outcome.description: Transcutaneous pO2 was assessed at the dorsum of the foot in the first intermetatarsal space using an appropriately calibrated instrument. The skin oxygen partial pressure was determined by measuring the oxygen reduction current by means of a measuring cell.

intervention.description: Pre-filled syringes containing a single dose of 5000 IU Fragmin/ Dalteparin Sodium.
Pre-filled syringes containing a single dose of placebo for 5000 IU Fragmin/ Dalteparin Sodium.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subjects 18 years of age with type 1 or type 2 diabetes.
- Subjects with peripheral occlusive arterial disease (PAOD) and a neuropathy disability score (NDS) of >3
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have undergone vascular reconstruction or angioplasty less than 1 month prior to randomization. Subjects with an ulcer grading of 0 or 3 and staging of A, B or D according to the University of Texas wound classification system.
- Subjects with a known bleeding disorder or evidence of active bleeding.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Dalteparin
group.description: Dalteparin 5000 International Units (IU) (0.2 milliliter [mL]) subcutaneously (s.c.) once daily for 24 weeks or early termination (ET).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo (0.2 mL normal saline) administered s.c. once daily for 24 weeks or ET.

group.title: Dalteparin
group.description: Dalteparin 5000 International Units (IU) (0.2 mL) subcutaneously (s.c.) once daily for 24 weeks or early termination (ET).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo (0.2 mL normal saline) administered s.c. once daily for 24 weeks or ET.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Greater Than or Equal to 50 Percent Reduction in Ulcer Surface Area Including Intact Skin Healing
outcome.description: University of Texas (UT) system assesses ulcer depth, wound infection and clinical signs of lower-extremity ischemia. UT Wound Classification (1C/2C) was based on grade (0= healed site to 3= penetrating wound to bone or joint) and stage (A= clean wounds to D= ischaemic infected wounds) of wounds. Participants were evaluated at 4 stratums: Stratum 1: Toe pressure>30 mm of mercury (mmHg) and UT grade and stage 1C. Stratum 2: Toe pressure<=30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 1C. Stratum 3: Toe pressure>30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 2C. Stratum 4: Toe pressure<=30 mmHg and UT grade and stage 2C.
outcome.time_frame: Week 24 [end of treatment (EOT)] or early termination
outcome.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population included all participants who were randomized. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) method was used. The 'n' is signifying those participants who received study drug and were evaluated for this measure at the timepoint for each group respectively.

outcome.title: Euro Quality of Life-5 Dimensions (EQ-5D)- Utility Score
outcome.description: EQ-5D: participant rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single utility score. It assesses level of current health for 5 domains: mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain and discomfort, and anxiety and depression; 1 indicates better health state (no problems); 3 indicates worst health state (eg, "confined to bed"). Scoring formula developed by EuroQol Group assigns a utility value for each domain in profile. Score is transformed and results in a total score range -0.594 to 1.000; higher score indicates a better health state.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (EOT or early termination)
outcome.population: ITT population included all participants who were randomized. Participants were only considered when all items contributing to the score had been answered. The 'n' is signifying those participants who received study drug and were evaluated for this measure at the timepoint for each group respectively.

Scoring formula developed by EuroQol Group assigns a utility value for each domain in profile. Score is transformed and results in a total score range -0.594 to 1.000; higher score indicates a better health state.

measure.description: EQ-5D: participant rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single index value. The VAS component rates current health state on a scale from 0 mm (worst imaginable health state) to 100 mm (best imaginable health state); higher scores indicate a better health state.

outcome.title: 36-Item Short-Form Health Survey (SF-36) Score
outcome.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, mental health. The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (EOT or early termination)
outcome.population: ITT population included all participants who were randomized. This was calculated only when more than half of the questions within dimension were answered. The 'n' is signifying those participants who received study drug and were evaluated for this measure at the timepoint for each group respectively.

group.title: Dalteparin

group.title: Placebo

measure.title: 36-Item Short-Form Health Survey (SF-36) Score
measure.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well being: physical and social functioning, physical and emotional role limitations, bodily pain, general health, vitality, mental health. The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).
measure.population: ITT population included all participants who were randomized. This was calculated only when more than half of the questions within dimension were answered. The 'n' is signifying those participants who received study drug and were evaluated for this measure at the timepoint for each group respectively.

outcome.title: 11-point Likert Pain Scale
outcome.description: The 11 point Likert pain scale which used a 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain) point rating system was used to assess participantâ€™s pain score. No distinction was made between neuropathy and inflammatory (nociceptive) pain.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (EOT or early termination)
outcome.population: ITT population included all participants who were randomized. The 'n' is signifying those participants who received study drug and were evaluated for this measure at the timepoint for each group respectively.

outcome.title: Transcutaneous Local Tissue Oxygenation (pO2)
outcome.description: Transcutaneous pO2 was assessed at the dorsum of the foot in the first intermetatarsal space using an appropriately calibrated instrument. The skin oxygen partial pressure was determined by measuring the oxygen reduction current by means of a measuring cell.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Week 24 (EOT or early termination)
outcome.population: ITT population included all participants who were randomized. Participants were analyzed at selected sites only, based on availability. The 'n' is signifying those participants who received study drug and were evaluated for this measure at the timepoint for each group respectively.

group.title: Dalteparin
group.description: Dalteparin 5000 International Units (IU) (0.2 mL) subcutaneously (s.c.) once daily for 24 weeks or early termination (ET).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo (0.2 mL normal saline) administered s.c. once daily for 24 weeks or ET.

measure.title: Transcutaneous Local Tissue Oxygenation (pO2)
measure.description: Transcutaneous pO2 was assessed at the dorsum of the foot in the first intermetatarsal space using an appropriately calibrated instrument. The skin oxygen partial pressure was determined by measuring the oxygen reduction current by means of a measuring cell.
measure.population: ITT population included all participants who were randomized. Participants were analyzed at selected sites only, based on availability. The 'n' is signifying those participants who received study drug and were evaluated for this measure at the timepoint for each group respectively.

outcome.title: Number of All Hemorrhages
outcome.description: Major hemorrhages: defined as fatal bleeding, clinically overt bleeding causing a fall in hemoglobin more than or equal to 20 gram (g)/litre (L) (2 g/ decilitre [dL]), clinically overt bleeding leading to transfusion of more than or equal to 2 units of whole blood or red cells, or symptomatic bleeding in areas of special concern (intracranial, retroperitoneal, intraocular, intraspinal, pericardial, intramuscular with compartmental syndrome, or intraarticular). Minor hemorrhages: defined as bleeding that did not meet the definition of major bleeding.
outcome.population: Safety analysis population included all participants who were known to have taken at least one dose of the study medication.

group.title: Placebo

measure.title: Number of All Hemorrhages
measure.description: Major hemorrhages: defined as fatal bleeding, clinically overt bleeding causing a fall in hemoglobin more than or equal to 20 gram (g)/litre (L) (2 g/ decilitre [dL]), clinically overt bleeding leading to transfusion of more than or equal to 2 units of whole blood or red cells, or symptomatic bleeding in areas of special concern (intracranial, retroperitoneal, intraocular, intraspinal, pericardial, intramuscular with compartmental syndrome, or intraarticular). Minor hemorrhages: defined as bleeding that did not meet the definition of major bleeding.
measure.population: Safety analysis population included all participants who were known to have taken at least one dose of the study medication.

outcome.description: Major hemorrhages: defined as fatal bleeding, clinically overt bleeding causing a fall in hemoglobin more than or equal to 20 gram (g)/litre (L) (2 g/ decilitre [dL]), clinically overt bleeding leading to transfusion of more than or equal to 2 units of whole blood or red cells, or symptomatic bleeding in areas of special concern (intracranial, retroperitoneal, intraocular, intraspinal, pericardial, intramuscular with compartmental syndrome, or intraarticular). Minor hemorrhages: defined as bleeding that did not meet the definition of major bleeding.

measure.title: Number of Major and Minor Hemorrhages
measure.description: Major hemorrhages: defined as fatal bleeding, clinically overt bleeding causing a fall in hemoglobin more than or equal to 20 gram (g)/litre (L) (2 g/ decilitre [dL]), clinically overt bleeding leading to transfusion of more than or equal to 2 units of whole blood or red cells, or symptomatic bleeding in areas of special concern (intracranial, retroperitoneal, intraocular, intraspinal, pericardial, intramuscular with compartmental syndrome, or intraarticular). Minor hemorrhages: defined as bleeding that did not meet the definition of major bleeding.
measure.population: Safety analysis population included all participants who were known to have taken at least one dose of the study medication.

outcome.title: Number of Clinically Relevant Minor Hemorrhages and Trivial Hemorrhages
outcome.description: Clinically relevant minor (non-major) bleeding was defined as any bleeding compromising hemodynamics, leading to hospitalization, subcutaneous haematoma more than 25 cm^2, intramuscular haematoma, epistaxis lasting for more than 5 minutes, spontaneous gingival bleeding, macroscopic hematuria and gastrointestinal hemorrhage (including at least 1 episode of melaena or hematemesis), rectal blood loss, hemoptysis, and any other bleeding with clinical consequences. Trivial bleeding was defined as all minor bleeding that did not meet the definition of clinically relevant minor bleeding.
outcome.population: Safety analysis population included all participants who were known to have taken at least one dose of the study medication.

group.title: Dalteparin
group.description: Dalteparin 5000 International Units (IU) (0.2 mL) subcutaneously (s.c.) once daily for 24 weeks or early termination (ET).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo (0.2 mL normal saline) administered s.c. once daily for 24 weeks or ET.

measure.title: Number of Clinically Relevant Minor Hemorrhages and Trivial Hemorrhages
measure.description: Clinically relevant minor (non-major) bleeding was defined as any bleeding compromising hemodynamics, leading to hospitalization, subcutaneous haematoma more than 25 cm^2, intramuscular haematoma, epistaxis lasting for more than 5 minutes, spontaneous gingival bleeding, macroscopic hematuria and gastrointestinal hemorrhage (including at least 1 episode of melaena or hematemesis), rectal blood loss, hemoptysis, and any other bleeding with clinical consequences. Trivial bleeding was defined as all minor bleeding that did not meet the definition of clinically relevant minor bleeding.
measure.population: Safety analysis population included all participants who were known to have taken at least one dose of the study medication.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Dalteparin
group.description: Dalteparin 5000 International Units (IU) (0.2 mL) subcutaneously (s.c.) once daily for 24 weeks or early termination (ET).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo (0.2 mL normal saline) administered s.c. once daily for 24 weeks or ET.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Study enrollment was terminated before planned number of participants was obtained. Although randomized participants were allowed to complete entire course of therapy according to protocol and study status was therefore designated as completed.
